abstract: Financial markets were rocked on Tuesday after Greece’s credit rating was slashed to junk status.
snippet: Financial markets were rocked on Tuesday after Greece’s credit rating was slashed to junk status.
lead_paragraph: Financial markets on Wall Street and in Europe were rocked on Tuesday after Greece’s credit rating was cut to junk status by a leading ratings agency, deepening fears that a debt crisis in Europe could spiral out of control.

headline.main: Stocks Drop Nearly 2 Percent After Greek Debt Is Downgraded
headline.print_headline: Shares Tumble, Dropping Dow Below 11,000, as Greek Debt Is Downgraded
